data.text:
Woody Allen By Esbeidy Granados

Biography • Woody Allen was born Allan Stewart Konigsberg on December 1, 1935, in The Bronx, New York. • As a kid he became intrigued with magic tricks and playing the clarinet, two things that he still does today. • Allen spent eight years in Hebrew School. • Older brother of LettyAronson whom he casts in many of his movies. • He married HarleneSusan Rosen(15 March 1956 - November 1962), Louise Lasser(2 February 1966 - January 1970), and is currently married to Soon-Yi Previn (22 December 1997 - present) Mia Farrow’s adopted daughter. • According to Mia Farrow's biography, "What Falls Away", Frank Sinatra offered to have Allen's legs broken when he was found to be having an affair with her adopted daughter, Soon-Yi Previn.

Debut • At the age of 15, he began writing jokes for a local paper for $200 a week. • At the age of 19, he started writing scripts for The Ed Sullivan Show, The Tonight Show, and he also did specials for Sid Caesar post-Caesar's Hour (1954–1957). • Was convinced to do stand up comedy by Warren Beatty. • What’s Up Tiger Lily?” A Japanese spy flick that he dubbed over with his own comedic dialogue about spies searching for the secret recipe for egg salad was considered his theoretical debut. • His actual directorial debut came in the mockumentary "Take the Money and Run."

Filmography • Woody Allen is best known for his romantic comedies • A lot of his movies feature at least one character who is a writer. This is often Woody himself. • Nearly all of his films start and end with white-on-black credits, set in the Windsor typeface, set to jazz music, without any scrolling. • His films are almost all set in New York City • Films his dialog using long, medium-range shots instead of the typical intercut close-ups

Frequently Cast Actresses • Woody Allen frequently casts himself, Diane Keaton, Mia Farrow, and Scarlett Johansson.

Annie Hall (1977) • Stars: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Tony Roberts, Carol Kane • Neurotic New York comedian Alvy Singer falls in love with the ditsy Annie Hall. • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TBzHphcc2Jw

Manhattan (1979) • Stars: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Mariel Hemingway, Michael Murphy • A divorced New Yorker currently dating a high-schooler brings himself to look for love in the mistress of his best friend instead. (96 mins.) • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuU6XU0_Gfs

Hannah and Her Sisters (1986) • Stars: Mia Farrow, Dianne Wiest, Michael Caine, Barbara Hershey • Between two Thanksgivings, Hannah's husband falls in love with her sister Lee, while her hypochondriac ex-husband rekindles his relationship with her sister Holly. • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qtgw38Yq2Qs

Crimes and Misdemeanors (1989) • Stars: Martin Landau, Woody Allen, Bill Bernstein, Claire Bloom • An ophthalmologist's mistress threatens to reveal their affair to his wife, while a married documentary filmmaker is infatuated by another woman. • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5wXqwL3akhw
